channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Street cleaning ineffective, 19th September
item.description:
The road sweeper came today to clean the streets of Benhall and this is the mess he left . All the roads are in the same condition.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 27-31, Benhall Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham

item.title: Wooden Safety barrier still not repaired, 19th September
item.description:
This is just a quick email to enquire about the damage to the wooden safety barrier on Station Road, Churchdown. It’s been damaged for over a year now (may be even two years!) and still hasn’t been replaced/repaired? To be fair, I wonder if it’s ever been reported before, but I remain hopeful that you may have news that it’s nearing the top of the list and being repaired very soon? I remember some rail/gas engineers moved the damaged barrier to the side many moons ago and it’s not moved since! There have been a number of engineering activities at that bridge over the last year or so, but none of them have come back to repair it! It’s quite unsightly. I’ve attached some photos and sharing a what3words address to help you find this specific location. ///flocking.blurs.station Hopefully hear from you very soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Station Road, Churchdown, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Tree and fence blocking visibility splay., 19th September
item.description:
Tree in between 72A and 74 Evesham Road located on Highways land is blocking the visibility splay when exiting 72A Evesham Road. The tree is covered in ivy and other climbing plants, as well as sprouting new growth. It is also encroaching onto the public footpath. The fence is also blocking the visibility splay and contrary to TBC planning permission.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 72, Evesham Road, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Broken glass on road, 18th September
item.description:
There is smashed glass all over the road here. It has been there for at least five days. This is a recurring problem here and is awful for cyclists, dogs etc. It needs daily inspections or make the adjacent bar owners deal with it.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, Vernon Place, Fairview, Cheltenham

item.title: Sunken cover, 18th September
item.description:
On pavement outside number 30 Greatfield Lane. Work has been completed today and freshly paved up to the cover - however there is a significant dip which poses a trip hazard to pedestrians and a danger to children riding bikes/scooters. It also poses a risk to buggies and wheelchair users which could easily be tipped.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Greatfield Lane, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: As shown in photos job was not complete, 18th September
item.description:
The fly tipped items are all still in place! The worker has even added to the lack of access in the one pathway by leaving his cuttings where they fell on the floor! I don’t think the council or whoever is responsible for this realises that I was referring to the entire rat run of alleyways and pathways around the estates here. Specifically the one at the back of the school where the school shrubbery is knocking the metal fence down by the weight of it, and the continuous pathway along the brook that runs all the way down to the park on Pilgrove way. It’s a disgrace that these potential enjoyable walks and safer paths to the schools are so unkempt.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Springbank Road, Golden Valley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
